name: Ahi and Avocado Poke Tower
author: Avocados from Mexico
summary: Poke (pronounced pok-eh) is a seasoned tartare, usually with tuna (ahi). If you love tuna sashimi or sushi, you will love this easy recipe which is spiced up with a little wasabi, which I love. Serve over hot sticky rice, with chips, or eat straight on as a salad.
ingredients: 1  green onion, white part only, thinly sliced
¼ pound raw sashimi-grade tuna, diced
1  ripe avocado from Mexico, peeled, pitted, cubed
directions: Mix soy sauce, wasabi, sesame oil and green onion together in a small bowl
Add diced tuna and stir to coat
Cover with plastic wrap and place in refrigerator to marinate for 2 hours
To construct the tower, mound and flatten the cucumber in the center of a serving platter
Top the cucumber with mango and then the avocado
Place the marinated tuna on top
To serve, place chips around the poke tower for scooping
Or serve with hot sticky (sushi) rice, or enjoy as is as a salad
